result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David A Mitchell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David A Mitchell was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $167 VW & DA surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

11:08 AM Defendant David A Mitchell in court with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  ADA Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 30 days  in the Dane County Jail - Deemed Served

-Days credit for time served: 23 days credit (5/13/22 - 6/4/22) 
-Days credit to jail: 23 days credit (5/13/22 - 6/4/22) 

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. DA surcharge and V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

02:59 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
